text: when spring rolls around and asparagus
comes into season I get so very excited
it's such a fresh delicious flavor and
so reminiscent of spring it just makes
me happy and to prepare it I like to
keep it as simple as possible so today
I'm making steamed asparagus with brown
butter and hazelnuts I've trimmed two
pounds of very tender asparagus and I'm
gonna steam them in a steamer basket
over here I have a pot of water it's
about two inches of water in a nice big
pot with a steamer basket insert just
put your asparagus on the basket it's
nice and even this is two pounds it's a
very very generous amount for four
people you can certainly do one pound
and probably use the same amount of
sauce even though it is made with butter
cover it up and cook it until it's
tender about five or six minutes I'm
making a brown butter sauce which is a
really nice but very very simple thing
to do and great accompaniment for
asparagus or other steamed vegetables so
to make brown butter what you want to do
is cook your butter kind of slowly like
not too fast because you could run it
until the bottom gets sort of
caramelized and Brown looking and the
foam subsides you can see that it's sort
of very aggressively bubbling right now
and there's a little foam on top that
will slow down as it cooks and the milk
solids which are the white part at the
bottom of the pan will turn nutty and
brown and that's a delicious flavor with
fresh spring vegetables like this every
once in a while just give your butter a
swirl you can see that the edges are
turning golden brown already that's what
I'm talking about and you kind of want
to be careful not to cook it too far all
right I can see that there is nice brown
bits on the bottom of the pan which is
exactly what I'm looking for
it's starting to smell nice and nutty
which is also fantastic I'm gonna turn
it off because it's gonna continue
browning and cooking and I don't want it
to go too far I'm gonna add my toasted
hazelnuts this is a half a cup of
chopped toasted hazelnuts you can
sprinkle this over the top or you can
just stir it right into the butter and
even though the recipe doesn't call for
it what I really like to do for a recipe
like this
to add a little bit of lemon I'm gonna
squeeze the juice of half a lemon into
my brown butter I don't know what it is
but the lemon going in there made it
smell so fantastic it's like a really
nutty aroma pull the asparagus out just
before you think that they're done
because they will continue cooking a
little bit unless you run them under
cold water which I am not doing I would
say cook it till it's tender not crunchy
in the center but with a little bit of
bite not because I added the lemon juice
to my butter it will start to make the
asparagus look a little bit less bright
green like a little bit olive but I
think the increase in flavor is well
worth it pour your butter your nutty
butter over the top a little bit of salt
and pepper oh my god you take a look at
that can you believe how beautiful it is
it's a thing of magnificence and a great
way to welcome spring
you
